intro: Thamnochortus membranaceus, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, succulent leaves that help reduce water loss. Thamnochortus membranaceus is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
